description.p: Your patron is not a demon, god, or fey—but Hate incarnate. It simply exists, as the purest reaction to injustice, betrayal, and divine silence. Those who serve Hate do not beg for power. They demand it.
Hate lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

When your spell reduces a creature to 0 hit points, you spread fear around with the hatred you unleashed. Use your Bonus action to force a creature of your choice up to Charisma modifier within 15 feet of the slain target to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier). On a fail, they are frightened of you until the end of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per short or long rest. Additionally, all your damaging spells or melee attacks count as dealing Force damage instead of their original damage type when hitting Clerics, Paladins, or Creatures with a Divine or Cosmic origin.

description.p: At 6th level, Your weapon and spell attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 against Divine or Cosmic related creatures this range is 18-20. Starting at 14th level, this range increases to 18–20 and for Divine or Cosmic related creatures 17-20.

sheet.description: Your weapon and spell attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. Against Divine or Cosmic related creatures this is 18-20.
Your weapon and spell attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20. Against Divine or Cosmic related creatures 17-20.

description.p: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

At 10th level, You can no longer be easily silenced or snuffed out. You gain resistance to radiant damage and fire damage and have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. You cannot be frightened by Cosmic or Divine origin creatures. If you fail a saving throw, you can choose to reroll it once. You must take the new result. Once per long rest.

sheet.description: You can reroll a saving throw that you failed. You must use the new roll. You have Advantage on Saving Throws against beign Charmed and Frightened. You cannot be Frightened by Cosmic or Divine origin creatures.

description.p: At 14th level, You manifest the raw presence of Hate. As an action, you unleash your true form for 1 minute. You get 1 level of exhaustion when this presence ends. When you deal force damage, you ignore resistance and immunity acts as resistance. Cosmic or Divine origin creatures are considered vulnerable to this damage type if they have no resistance or immunity. Each turn one of your attacks can deal extra 2d8 force damage. Enemies of Divine or Cosmic origin creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against you while within 15 feet. If you reduce such a creature to 0 HP during this state, you can choose to frighten all creatures of your choice within 30 feet with DC (spell save dc) Wisdom Saving Throw. Divine or Cosmic origin creatures dont roll. and drop 1 HP instead. But you gain 1 level of exhaustion.

description.p: Your patron grants you a weapon of pure, unrelenting hate—a warhammer forged from cosmic spite and divine betrayal. You can summon this hammer as an action, and it disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. You are proficient with this weapon while wielding it.

It deals 1d4 bludgeoning and 1d4 force damage when wielded in one hand, or 1d4 bludgeoning and 1d6 force damage when wielded in two hands. When a creature takes damage from this hammer, it cannot make opportunity attacks until the end of your next turn. The bludgeoning damage dealt by this hammer ignores resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning damage; it is treated as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity. This weapon counts as a Pact weapon for you and can be summoned or dismissed at will as part of your pact.

sheet.description: Create a hammer in your empty hand. This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. Your pact weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required), or if you die. It deals 1d4 bludgeoning and 1d4 force damage when wielded in one hand, or 1d4 bludgeoning and 1d6 force damage when wielded in two hands.

description.p: Your hatred strikes not just the body, but the soul. When you hit a creature with your Pact Hammer, you may force it to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = your spell save DC). On a failed save, the target becomes Haunted by the echo of your blow until the end of your next turn. While Haunted:
The target has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes. If it misses you with an attack, it takes force damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1).
You can use this effect a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.
